This is a transcode. Look at the spectrals. Fuck this and fuck FiNsTeRc.

Of course there is transcoding. How do you think the music gets from the CDDA format on the CD to MP3. It's direct digital-to-digital conversion. CD music is stored @ 1411.2 kbps on the CD and is down sampled to 320kbps when ripped to MP3.
 By the way most people who are downloading this have no idea what transcode or spectrals mean. They just know it's a good quality rip.

OK lets engage in some more geeky tech talk to bore the people who simply want to download some good music. Again you are apparently a novice judging from your understanding of what transcode truly is.  As I mentioned before transcode is simply the process of converting one codec to another. By this definition ALL MP3 files from CD rips are transcode. The only time transcode would be used to describe merely converting bit rates is for video, not audio.  You can learn all about this stuff in college, really I did. What you are alluding to is upsampling. Of course this rip is not. Kind of pointless to rip a CD to a low bit rate then upsample to 320 kbps. Now if the spectral frequencies are confusing you, that would probably be because you are used to seeing MP3s ripped with WMP or some other lame PC software. My CD?s are ripped on a professional mixing system using WaveLab.  Now that you have been educated I?ll just second seriousluboy83?s comment above.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transcode

Maybe you should go to college and learn about how words can have multiple definitions, stupidass.

Aight guys, here's what it is. 

First up, for all you guys saying Jay-Z isn't shit, or is shit, or hating in any way, let me ask you this: If you don't like Jay-Z, why are you browsing for a torrent with his music? Save yourself the time and us the annoyance of reading through useless comments when deciding whether a torrent is legit or not. Thanks

Second, this track listing is completely correct, features, producers and everything. I grabbed a hard copy of this album, but have since lost it. However, this matches that album perfectly. iTunes removed it, so don't quote that please.

Third, transcoding can mean any number of things pertaining to code, so @FINsTeRc is completely correct in saying that while this is a transcode, it is a full quality rip. Please educate yourselves on things before you go making fools of yourselves. Unless you have a professional rig and quite a bit of hard drive space, nobody actually rips in CDDA format. It's impractical. If you really want fantastic quality, go buy the CD yourselves and rip into an OGG Vorbis or FLAC container, and quit complaining about things you get for FREE. 

Thank you, and remember, be kind to the internet, and it will be kind back =)
